intro: Paraboea glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Paraboea glandulosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
